testcase.name: Callback when When Auto-Cache placements gets sleep
testcase.summary: Callback when When Auto-Cache placements gets sleep
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install app 
2. Initialize the app

step.actions:
1) fresh install

2) no cached ad

3) initialize SDK

4) Observe Ads API call in Charles
step.expectedresults:
1. SDK sends “ads” api call and get sleep code as response (need to force to return sleep code here)
  2. Check that you get “onAdAvailabilityUpdate/vungleAdPlayabilityUpdate (isAdAvailable = false)” for auto-cache placement
  3. Sleep codes should apply to individual placements

testcase.name: Callback when Start app with sleeping auto cache placement from previous session
testcase.summary: Callback when Start app with sleeping auto cache placement from previous session
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install app 
2. Initialize the app

step.actions:
1)  Start app with sleeping auto cache placement from previous session

2)  initialize SDK

3)  Observe Ads API call in Charles
step.expectedresults:
1) check SDK WILL NOT send “ads” call (since it should be sleeping.)

2) check that you get “ onAdAvailabilityUpdate/vungleAdPlayabilityUpdate (isAdAvailable = false)” for auto-cache placement

testcase.name: Callback for the auto-cache placement which is sleeping
testcase.summary: Callback for the auto-cache placement which is sleeping
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install app 
2. Initialize the app

step.actions:
1) Initialize app while auto-cache placement is sleeping (or any other placements)

2) Call loadAd for the auto-cache placement

3) Observe Ads API call in Charles
step.expectedresults:
1) check SDK WILL NOT send “ads” call (since it should be sleeping.)

2) check that  you get “onAdAvailabilityUpdate/vungleAdPlayabilityUpdate (isAdAvailable = false)” for auto-cache placement

step.expectedresults: SDK should download an Ad for the amazon placement id when auto cache flag is enabled.

testcase.name: Ad Unit Caching
testcase.summary: Check caching of multiple Ad's
testcase.preconditions:
Play the Ad on App
Observe the Chrales

step.actions:
1)Install the App on amazon device and set charles Proxy.
2)Enter the amazon placement id's.
3)Initialize the SDK.
4)Observe the charles.
5)Play the Ads.
6) Repeat 3,4,5
step.expectedresults:
1) SDK should download multiple Ads for all amazon placement id's with respect to amazon placement priority.
2) If amazon placements have the same Metadata the Ad should not be downloaded twice.
3) If an Ad is already downloaded and if the App tries to download an Ad with same meta data, the SDK should use the Cached Ad and not download again.
4) Based on the Auto Cache Flag in the test app, The ad for the particularamazon placement id will be downloaded automatically.

Note:-
This will happen only when Metadata for 2 Ad's is the same

testcase.name: Manipulate the "sleep" parameter value in response of ads
testcase.summary: check Manipulate the "sleep" parameter value in response of ads
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install app 
2. Initialize the app

step.actions:
1) Map ads response with sleep response.
2) Initialize app
3) Observe Ads API call in Charles
step.expectedresults: The SDK should wait the amount of sleep seconds specified by the server

step.actions:
Enter:
AppID: 595d73ee3087f51025000040
Placements: DEFAULT63909, GOSLEEP27738, MRAID0058210
 
Steps:
1. Launch the test app
2. LoadAd for sleep placement id (this gets sleep response)
3. LoadAd for sleep placement id
step.expectedresults: User should not be able to LoadAd if  SDK receive sleep response from the previous LoadAd request

step.actions:
Enter:
AppID: 595d73ee3087f51025000040
Placements: DEFAULT63909, GOSLEEP27738, MRAID0058210
 
Steps:
1. Launch the test app
2. LoadAd for sleep placement id (this gets sleep response)
3. LoadAd for sleep placement id
step.expectedresults:
1) Sleep on ads response should affect only on the specific placement for that duration.
2) Except the Placement that got sleep, SDK should be able to prepare ads for other Placements.
3) For any sleep response SDK should return Ad Unavailable for that Placement.
4) Sleep for auto cached ads on expiration, should resume preparation of ad.
5) Sleep for non auto cached ad should not resume preparation of ad automatically.
6) On context switching to other apps, or even in case of forced stop or kill the app, on resuming or re initialisation of SDK should Honor any existing sleep for Placements.

testcase.name: Close button behavior for MRAID video
testcase.summary: Based on "INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" and "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" parameter value, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions:
Play the Ad on App
Observe the Chrales

step.actions:
1)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999",
"CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5",
2)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5",
"CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999",
3)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999",
"CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999",
set thees value in Ads response API
step.expectedresults:
1) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value,
which is 5. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button.
2) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value,
which is skippable close button; otherwise, it should delay for 5 seconds.
3) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value,
which is 9999 which is skippable close button.. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button.

testcase.name: force view for native ads
testcase.summary: Check if Force View setting is honored for Native Ads
testcase.preconditions:
1)Set force view true/false on dashboard/Json file
2)initialize the App and play the ads.

step.actions:
1)Set force view true/false on dashboard/Json file
2)initialize the App and play the ads.
3)Observe the close and incentivized button on video.
step.expectedresults:
The SDK should honor the Force View Setting for native ads
Example: if the ad is set to true for force view, SDK should always play an native AD that cannot be closed by the user before the video is complete, and opposite for Force view set to false.

buttons:-

b)Continue:- Tap on continue button And should resume when it pause.

testcase.name: Test Invalid VAST
testcase.summary: Check if SDK behaves accordingly when we malform response of "ads" API call.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the app.

2.Initialize the app.

step.actions:
1. Prepare malformed response as

"moat": {

     "is_enabled": false,
     "extra_vast": ""

2.Start Test app.

3.Map "ads" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return malformed response.

4.Check SDK behaves accordingly.
step.expectedresults: SDK should not crash & should keep retrying to get valid ads.The SDK should be able to play ads.

testcase.name: To check ordinal data parameter in report ad.
testcase.summary: Check ordinal view data count .
testcase.preconditions:
1)Install the app.

2)Intialize the app.

step.actions:
1. Tap on placement id of flexview ad.
  2. Tap on configure placement ad.
  3. Set ordinal view data count as eg. 0/alphabets/special characters.
  4. Load and Play ad and observe charles.
  5. close the ad and check report ad api request for "ordinal count" parameter.
step.expectedresults: Ordinal count should not display in reportAd of native ad.

step.actions:
1. Tap on placement id of flexview ad.
  2. Tap on configure placement ad.
  3. Set ordinal view data count as 1,2, etc i.e. value >0.
  4. Load and play ad.
  5. Close ad and check report ad api request for "ordinal count" parameter.
step.expectedresults: "Ordinal count" should  display configured value in reportAd.
